reporting_cycle: before the end of the mandate period
summary:
The Security Council, recalling previous resolutions on Western Sahara, reaffirms its support for the Secretary-General's efforts and commitment to a just, lasting, and mutually acceptable political solution for self-determination. It calls on parties and regional States to cooperate with the UN to end the impasse. 

The Council reaffirms the need for full respect of military agreements with MINURSO regarding the ceasefire. It calls on Member States to consider voluntary contributions for Confidence Building Measures, particularly family unification visits.

The Secretary-General is requested to report on the Western Sahara situation before the mandate period ends and to ensure MINURSO's compliance with the UN's zero-tolerance policy on sexual exploitation and abuse.

The Council extends MINURSO's mandate until 30 April 2007 and decides to remain seized of the matter.
